definition: lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Arch dam construction in China has developed and the quantity stands first.
sentences.chinese: 我國拱壩建設也後來居上，數量已是世界第一。

sentences.english: Who knows what happened to that hand-out, but we came from far behind to win.
sentences.chinese: 誰知道發生了什麼事，我們卻後來居上獲得了訂單。

sentences.english: We're going to come from behind and win this game, coach.
sentences.chinese: 我們將後來居上，贏得這場比賽，教練。
